channel.title: The Fruity Tropics
channel.description: Recent content on The Fruity Tropics

item.title: Maracuya
item.description: Maracuya (Passion Fruit) Passiflora edulis. Passion Fruit, or Maracuya in Spanish, is one of 550 species of the genus Passiflora. Commonly available from farmers markets in Costa Rica, it’s a oval yellow fruit, typically around the size of an apple. It has a firm outer shell containing a pulpy/juicy mass fruit and seeds inside. Typically we will cut it in half, scoop out the insides and use them in smoothies, although it’s also delicious over yogurt.
